wikipedia_page.main: Helena Cécile Ernstone, (née Hélène Cecilia Schott; circa 1841 Gibraltar – 2 July 1933 Ferndown, Dorset, England) was an English actress who appeared in London theatres from 1867 to 1881.

response: * Helen Ernstone, English actress and daughter of Adam Joseph Schott (1794–1864)

Neville continued building his reputation on the London stage in the 1870s as actor and also as the manager of the Olympic Theatre from 1873 to 1879, where his company included rising actors such as Rutland Barrington, Helen Ernstone, Emily Fowler and Johnston Forbes-Robertson.The Olympic Theatre: Static Information - list of managers, accessed 21 May 2009The Times, 6 July 1877, p. 42; and 4 September 1878, p. 3  In 1870, he played Henry Little in Put Yourself in His Place at the Adelphi.  In 1872 he had a great success in The School for Scandal of which The Times said, "Mr Henry Neville is the leading actor in the class of characters in which Charles Surface is comprised."The Times, 12 November 1872, p. 5  This was followed, at the Olympic, by The School for Intrigue, in which he played the part of Almaviva.  Other successes during the 1870s, both as manager and actor, included his portrayal of Lord Clancarty in Taylor's Lady Clancarty, Pierre in John Oxenford's The Two Orphans in 1874, an 1874–75 revival of The Ticket-of-Leave Man, and Franklin Blake in a dramatisation of Wilkie Collins's The Moonstone in 1877.  In the same year he produced and starred in a revival of Lady Audley's Secret by Robert Walters.The Times, 6 July 1877, p. 4  He also produced W. S. Gilbert's plays The Ne'er-do-Weel in 1878 and  Gretchen in 1879.The Times, 24 March 1879, p. 10
